records.location_details: The incident occurred at the Pournara First Reception Centre in Cyprus, specifically in one of the containers not usually used for interviewing, after working hours. The migrant was apprehended at the disembarkation location in Cyprus by local officers supported by Frontex staff.
records.location_text_raw: premises of Pournara First Reception Centre in Cyprus

possible_violations.violation_name: Prohibition of inhuman or degrading treatment
possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 4 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union

records.context_note: A migrant alleged ill-treatment during an interrogation by four unidentified officers at Pournara First Reception Centre in Cyprus on 21/07/2023. The migrant claimed he was slapped 4-5 times on the head and neck and forced to sign a statement that he had departed from Lebanon instead of Syria. The Fundamental Rights Office considers the allegations relatively credible but could not independently corroborate them due to lack of cooperation from Cypriot authorities.
records.evidence_quote: during this "interrogation" the migrant was slapped 4-5 times on the head and neck and was forced to sign a statement that he had departed from Lebanon and not Syria as he had claimed before.
